item.title: Embedded Rust Programming on WSL (RISC-V)
item.description: Image Courtesy of SiFive, Inc. I recently picked up the SiFive HiFive 1 Rev B RISC-V microcontroller on Crowd Supply. According to the SiFive product page, the HiFive 1 Rev B is “an Arduino-compatible development board featuring the SiFive Freedom E310-G002 (FE310-G002) SoC plus a ESP32-SOLO-1 Wi-Fi and Bluetooth module”. I have seen examples for this board written in C, Rust, and TinyGo. Having not used Rust as much as I would like, I wanted to start there for development on this platform.
